page.title: 17LOWESTOFT'S FISHING INDUSTRY
page.content: As the traditional trawling fleet has declined the longshore fleet has greatly increased in numbers. Longshore boats get their name because they only fish a few miles from shore. They are usually 30 to 60 feet long and carry a small crew of 3 to 6. They either use trawls or longlines to catch fish. Trawling is done by trailing a net on the bottom of the seabed catching cod, plaice, whiting, sole and skate. Longling is very different, miles of lines are strung out behind the boats. Each line contains hundreds of baited hooks attached to it by small strings called snuds. At regular intervals a small anchor weighs the line down on the seabed. This method is mainly used for dogfish and cod.
